programme.title: Up & Adams
programme.desc: Kay Adams and a rotating roster of current and former players discuss the biggest storylines in the NFL.

programme.title: PokerStars Caribbean Adventure
programme.desc: Day 2 of the $100k buy-in event continues, as Kevin Hart eyes his first live tournament cash, and Daniel Negreanu aims for his third PCA Super High Roller final table.

programme.title: PokerStars Caribbean Adventure
programme.desc: It's the final table of the $100k Super High Roller. Justin Bonomo, Daniel Negreanu, Bryn Kenney and businessman Cary Katz are among those in contention for the near $1.5m first prize.

programme.title: PokerStars Caribbean Adventure
programme.desc: The first major poker tournament of 2018 has a $1m first prize. There's a Brazilian flavour to Day 2, with pro Andre Akkari and dance teacher Charles Modesto at the feature tables.

programme.title: PokerStars Caribbean Adventure
programme.desc: All hail, Mo the Destroyer! A Canadian qualifier takes his seat on the main stage, aiming for the $1m top prize, as Day 2 of this $10,000 poker tournament continues.

programme.title: PokerStars Caribbean Adventure
programme.desc: It's money bubble time in the Main Event. Aiming to lock up a slice of the $5.6m prize pool, are pros Liv Boeree and Barry Greenstein, plus qualifier Gleidibe Brito.

programme.title: PokerStars Caribbean Adventure
programme.desc: Coverage of the annual poker tournament.

programme.title: PokerStars Caribbean Adventure
programme.desc: Day 4 of the Main Event features poker pros, online qualifiers, a professional psychologist and a mother and son, all competing for their share of the $5.6m prize pool.

programme.title: PokerStars Caribbean Adventure
programme.desc: Top tournament pro David Peters leads the way in the $10,000 Main Event, with just 24 players remaining. His opponents include a couple of former EPT champions.

programme.title: PokerStars Caribbean Adventure
programme.desc: On the penultimate day of the Main Event, David Peters continues to dominate, and is the firm favourite to lift the PCA 2018 trophy and win the first prize of $1m.

programme.title: PokerStars Caribbean Adventure
programme.desc: The race to the final table is on. 10 players remain, including Adrian Mateos and Koray Aldemir. Only 6 will advance, and compete for the title, trophy and first prize of $1m.

programme.title: PokerStars Caribbean Adventure
programme.desc: There's more than $1m on the line at the Main Event final table. The final 6 include former EPT champ Adrian Mateos, and pros Shawn Buchanan and Maria Lampropulos.
